title: Understanding Entropy in Phase Changes
text: When a substance undergoes a phase change, such as ice melting into water, the order of molecules within the substance changes. With ice turning to liquid water, what happens to the structure and order of the molecules?

title: Molecular Order During Melting
text: Ice at 0°C has a structured, solid lattice. When it melts, this ordered structure is disrupted. Is the system becoming more or less ordered as ice turns to water?

title: Determining the Entropy Change
text: Melting involves breaking the rigid lattice structure of ice, leading to a more disordered state as liquid water. Given that entropy is a measure of disorder, what happens to the entropy when ice melts?
